Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394825) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394825)
